briefTitle: ENVISION: A Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Givosiran (ALN-AS1) in Patients With Acute Hepatic Porphyrias (AHP)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* â‰¥ 12 years of age
* Diagnosed with Acute Hepatic Porphyria (Acute Intermittent Porphyria, Hereditary Corproporhyria, Variegate Porphyria, aminolevulinic acid (ALA) dehydratase deficient porphyria)
* Elevated urinary or plasma porphobilinogen (PBG) or ALA values within the past year,
* Have active disease, with at least 2 documented porphyria attacks within the last 6 months
* Willing to discontinue or not initiate the use of prophylactic hemin throughout the study.
* Women of child bearing potential must have a negative serum pregnancy test, not be nursing, and use acceptable contraception

Exclusion Criteria:

* Clinically significant abnormal laboratory results
* Anticipated liver transplantation
* History of multiple drug allergies or intolerance to subcutaneous injections
* Active HIV, hepatitis C virus, or hepatitis B virus infection(s)
* History of recurrent pancreatitis

outcomeMeasures.title: Annualized Rate of Porphyria Attacks in Participants With Acute Intermittent Porphyria (AIP)
outcomeMeasures.description: Porphyria attacks were defined as meeting all of the following criteria: an acute episode of neurovisceral pain in the abdomen, back, chest, extremities and/or limbs, no other medically determined cause, and required treatment with intravenous (IV) dextrose or hemin, carbohydrates, or analgesics, or other medications such as antiemetics at a dose or frequency beyond the participant's usual daily porphyria management. The annualized rate of porphyria attacks is a composite endpoint which included porphyria attacks requiring hospitalization, urgent healthcare visit, or IV hemin administration at home.

outcomeMeasures.title: The Pharmacodynamic (PD) Effect of Givosiran on Urine Levels of Delta-aminolevulinic Acid (ALA) in Participants With AIP
outcomeMeasures.description: The PD effect of givosiran was evaluated by spot urine ALA levels normalized to spot urine creatinine levels.

outcomeMeasures.title: The PD Effect of Givosiran on Urine Levels of Porphobilinogen (PBG) in Participants With AIP
outcomeMeasures.description: The PD effect of givosiran was evaluated by spot urine PBG levels normalized to spot urine creatinine levels.

outcomeMeasures.title: Annualized Rate of Hemin Administration in Participants With AIP
outcomeMeasures.description: Annualized rate of hemin doses was evaluated as annualized days of hemin use.

outcomeMeasures.title: Annualized Rate of Porphyria Attacks in Participants With AHP
outcomeMeasures.description: Porphyria attacks were defined as meeting all of the following criteria: an acute episode of neurovisceral pain in the abdomen, back, chest, extremities and/or limbs, no other medically determined cause, and required treatment with intravenous (IV) dextrose or hemin, carbohydrates, or analgesics, or other medications such as antiemetics at a dose or frequency beyond the participant's usual daily porphyria management. The annualized rate of porphyria attacks is a composite endpoint which included porphyria attacks requiring hospitalization, urgent healthcare visit, or IV hemin administration at home.

outcomeMeasures.title: Area Under the Curve (AUC) of the Change From Baseline in Weekly Mean Score of Daily Worst Pain as Measured by the Brief Pain Inventory-Short Form (BPI-SF) Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) in Participants With AIP
outcomeMeasures.description: Participants rated worst daily pain score in an eDiary using the 11-point BPI-SF NRS, in which 0=no pain and 10=worst pain. Daily eDiary entries were averaged into a weekly (i.e. 7 day) score. The change from baseline in weekly mean scores is defined as the post baseline weekly mean score minus the baseline score. Lower scores indicate an improvement. The 6-month AUC was calculated based on change from baseline in weekly mean scores.

outcomeMeasures.title: Average Change From Baseline in Weekly Mean Score of Daily Worst Pain as Measured by the Brief Pain Inventory-Short Form (BPI-SF) Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) in Participants With AIP
outcomeMeasures.description: Participants rated worst daily pain score in an eDiary using the 11-point BPI-SF NRS, in which 0=no pain and 10=worst pain. Lower scores indicate an improvement.

Daily eDiary entries were averaged into a weekly (i.e. 7 day) score. The change from baseline in weekly mean scores is defined as the post baseline weekly mean score minus the baseline score. Lower scores indicate an improvement. The 6-month AUC was calculated based on change from baseline in weekly mean scores.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in the Physical Component Summary (PCS) of the 12-Item Short Form Survey (SF-12) in Participants With AIP
outcomeMeasures.description: The SF-12 is a survey designed for use in patients with multiple chronic conditions. This 12-item scale can be used to assess the physical and mental health of respondents. 10 of the 12 questions are answered on a 5 point likert scale and 2 are answered on a 3 point likert scale. The questions are then scored and weighted into 2 subscales, physical health and mental health. Respondents can have a score that ranges from 0-100 with 100 being the best score and indicating high physical or mental health. A 3 point change in SF-12 score reflects a meaningful difference. A higher score indicates improvement.
